Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the study described in the consent form?
A) The study is a routine medical check-up with no research components.
B) The study is a commercial product trial for a new infant formula.
C) The study is a research project investigating the integration of smoking cessation and breastfeeding programs.
D) The study is a non-research based public health initiative for new mothers.

Correct answer: C) The study is a research project investigating the integration of smoking cessation and breastfeeding programs.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program research study?
A) To evaluate the effectiveness of new infant formulas; B) To assess the impact of prenatal vitamins on child development; C) To promote smoking abstinence and breastfeeding and assess their effects on maternal and child health; D) To study the psychological impact of parenting classes on new mothers

Correct answer: C

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For how long will participants be involved in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?
A) Up to 12 months postpartum; B) Up to 18 months postpartum; C) Up to 24 months postpartum; D) Throughout pregnancy only
Correct answer: B) Up to 18 months postpartum

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding additional costs to the subject in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?
A) Subjects will be responsible for the costs of medical procedures and tests related to the study.
B) Subjects will incur additional costs for participating in the study, which are not covered by the study compensation.
C) There are no additional costs to the subjects for participating in the study, and any study-related procedures will be covered by the study funds.
D) Subjects will need to pay for the transportation to the study site for each visit.

Correct answer: C) There are no additional costs to the subjects for participating in the study, and any study-related procedures will be covered by the study funds.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following best describes the procedures that participants will undergo during the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?

A) Participants will only complete surveys at the beginning and end of the study.
B) Participants will be asked to complete various surveys and attend intervention visits both prenatally and postpartum, including mother-infant interaction observations.
C) Participants will be required to attend daily clinic visits for the duration of the study.
D) Participants will only be involved in the study during their pregnancy and not postpartum.

Correct answer: B) Participants will be asked to complete various surveys and attend intervention visits both prenatally and postpartum, including mother-infant interaction observations.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to take part in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?
A) 20; B) 40; C) 80; D) 100
Correct answer: C) 80

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?
A) Increased risk of developing gestational diabetes; B) Pain and engorgement during breastfeeding; C) Risk of severe allergic reactions to study materials; D) Risk of data being shared with commercial third parties without consent

Correct answer: B) Pain and engorgement during breastfeeding

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit of participating in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program research study?
A) Guaranteed improvement in maternal and infant health
B) Direct medical benefits to the participant
C) Contribution to scientific knowledge that may inform clinical practices and public health policy
D) Free medical treatment for the duration of the study

Correct answer: C) Contribution to scientific knowledge that may inform clinical practices and public health policy

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What is the alternative to participating in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?
A) Enrolling in a different research study focused on maternal health; B) Receiving standard care without additional support or intervention; C) Undergoing a specialized individual counseling program for smoking cessation; D) There is no alternative mentioned in the consent form.

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the confidentiality measures for personal health information in this research study?
A) Personal health information will be shared publicly for educational purposes.
B) Personal health information may be shared with clinical staff not involved in the study if relevant to treatment, and with organizations responsible for research oversight.
C) All personal health information will be kept completely secret and will not be shared with anyone.
D) Personal health information will only be shared with the principal investigator and no other parties.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study, what kind of compensation or medical treatment is available to you according to the consent form?

A) Free medical treatment for the injury and financial compensation for participation.
B) Financial compensation for participation, but no specific compensation for injuries related to the study.
C) Free medical treatment for the injury, but no financial compensation for participation.
D) Both free medical treatment for the injury and financial compensation for participation are available.

Correct answer: B) Financial compensation for participation, but no specific compensation for injuries related to the study.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience any issues or have concerns related to the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study, whom should you contact first?

A) Your personal healthcare provider
B) The principal investigator, Xiaozhong Wen, or the research team at (716) 829-6811
C) The University at Buffalo Institutional Review Board (UBIRB)
D) The National Institutes of Health (NIH)

Correct answer: B) The principal investigator, Xiaozhong Wen, or the research team at (716) 829-6811

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you decide not to participate in the Integrated smoking cessation and breastfeeding program study?

A) You will lose access to certain medical benefits.
B) You will not be able to receive any medical care from the institution.
C) Your decision will have no impact on your current or future medical care or access to benefits.
D) You will be penalized by the research team.

Correct answer: C
